name: Energy Arc
text: Untap any number of target creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by those creatures this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Relent, and you may transcend your situation."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

"Relent, and you may transcend your situation."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

name: Energy Bolt
text:
Choose one —
• Energy Bolt deals X damage to target player.
• Target player gains X life.

editions.flavor: Life and death are two faces of the same coin.

name: Energy Chamber
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target artifact creature.
• Put a charge counter on target noncreature artifact.

name: Energy Field
text:
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you by sources you don't control.
When a card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, sacrifice Energy Field.

name: Energy Flux
text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

editions.flavor:
"Nothing endures but change."
—Heraclitus
Karn said nothing—he just grasped the powerstone and squeezed tightly. The wild flashing ceased.

name: Energy Storm
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by instant and sorcery spells.
Creatures with flying don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

name: Energy Tap
text: Tap target untapped creature you control. If you do, add an amount of {C} to your mana pool equal to that creature's converted mana cost.

name: Energy Vortex
text:
As Energy Vortex enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove all vortex counters from Energy Vortex.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Energy Vortex deals 3 damage to that player unless he or she pays {1} for each vortex counter on Energy Vortex.
{X}: Put X vortex counters on Energy Vortex. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Enervate
text:
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran royal mage

name: Enfeeblement
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.

editions.flavor:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek

"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek

"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek
Crovax had witnessed Selenia lead the Predator to the Weatherlight. As the battle raged on deck, he felt his strength melt in the heat of her betrayal.

name: Engineered Explosives
text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{2}, Sacrifice Engineered Explosives: Destroy each nonland permanent with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Engineered Explosives.

name: Engineered Might
text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Creatures you control get +2/+2 and gain vigilance until end of turn.

name: Engineered Plague
text:
As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.

editions.flavor:
"The admixture of bitterwort in the viral brew has produced most favorable results."
—Phyrexian progress notes
A single germ can kill more soldiers than ten thousand blades.

"The admixture of bitterwort in the viral brew has produced most favorable results."
—Phyrexian progress notes

name: Engulfing Flames
text:
Engulfing Flames deals 1 damage to target creature. It can't be regenerated this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Engulfing Slagwurm
text: Whenever Engulfing Slagwurm blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor: Its teeth exist only for decoration.

name: Engulf the Shore
text: Return to their owners' hands all creatures with toughness less than or equal to the number of Islands you control.

editions.flavor:
"The tides have begun to ignore the moon."
—Tamiyo's journal

name: Enhanced Awareness
text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.

editions.flavor:
"Study the topography of your enemies, and you will have a map to victory."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

name: Enigma Drake
text:
Flying
Enigma Drake's power is equal to the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Many initiates believe it possesses secrets known only to Kefnet himself. Many have become meals trying to learn them.

name: Enigma Eidolon
text:
{U}, Sacrifice Enigma Eidolon: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Enigma Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Enigma Sphinx
text:
Flying
When Enigma Sphinx is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put it into your library third from the top.
Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)

name: Enigma Sphinx Avatar
text: Whenever you cast a colored artifact spell for the first time in a turn, search your library for a colored artifact card chosen at random whose converted mana cost is less than that spell's converted mana cost. You may play that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, put that card on the bottom of your library.

editions.flavor: ARB Prize Avatar

name: Enlarge
text: Target creature gets +7/+7 and gains trample until end of turn. It must be blocked this turn if able. (If a creature with trample would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

name: Enlightened Ascetic
text: When Enlightened Ascetic enters the battlefield, you may destroy target enchantment.

editions.flavor: "I do not reject the gods. I reject their authority, their pettiness, and their arrogance."

name: Enlightened Maniac
text: When Enlightened Maniac enters the battlefield, create a 3/2 colorless Eldrazi Horror creature token.

editions.flavor: "At last! Proof that it's not all in my head!"

name: Enlightened Tutor
text: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

editions.flavor:
"I do not teach. I simply reveal."
—Daudi, Femeref tutor

"I do not teach. I simply reveal."
—Daudi, Femeref tutor

"Organization is often undervalued but rarely unjustified."
—Frasio, royal archivist

"I do not teach. I simply reveal."
—Daudi, Femeref tutor

name: Enlisted Wurm
text: Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)

editions.flavor: A match for any army—even its own.
A match for any army—even its own.
A match for any army—even its own.

name: Enlistment Officer
text:
First strike
When Enlistment Officer enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Soldier cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.
Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

name: Enrage
text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The barbarians call it "touching the soul of the dragon."
The barbarians call it "touching the soul of the dragon."
"You wouldn't like me when I'm angry."
"You wouldn't like me when I'm angry."

name: Enraged Giant
text:
Improvise (Your artifacts can help cast this spell. Each artifact you tap after you're done activating mana abilities pays for {1}.)
Trample, haste

editions.flavor: When fighting spilled over into Giant's Walk, the aether weapons and swooping airships angered the normally placid creatures.

name: Enraged Revolutionary
text: Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: When every right is voted away, only rage remains.

name: Enraging Licid
text:
{R}, {T}: Enraging Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {R} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has haste.

name: Enshrined Memories
text: Reveal the top X cards of your library. Put all creature cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor:
"The race is run in the mind before the first step is taken."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Enshrouding Mist
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to it this turn. If it's renowned, untap it.

editions.flavor: True faith is letting the blade fall without parry. True cunning is using that moment to strike a deadly blow.

name: Enslave
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, enchanted creature deals 1 damage to its owner.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana

editions.flavor: Phyrexia extended its command until there was nothing left to take.

name: Enslaved Dwarf
text: {R}, Sacrifice Enslaved Dwarf: Target black creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Captive dwarves always regain their freedom, either through escape or through a desperate, fiery death.

name: Enslaved Horror
text: When Enslaved Horror enters the battlefield, each other player may return a creature card from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

name: Enslaved Scout
text: {2}: Enslaved Scout gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

editions.flavor:
"Her soldiers' hatred for the Goblins is tempered only by their need for what the Goblins alone hold: knowledge of their mountain home."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

"Even the basest creatures may serve a purpose. Still, their lives need be only as long as the paths we tread."
—General Varchild

name: Ensnare
text:
You may return two Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay Ensnare's mana cost.
Tap all creatures.

editions.flavor: Rootwater has become as dangerous to its denizens as to its enemies.

name: Ensnaring Bridge
text: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.

editions.flavor:
"With a few minor adjustments, we were able to convert sky-dock assisters into a defense system for the Aether Spire."
—Consulate engineer's log

"I expected a fight, but I didn't expect it from the building itself."
—Gerrard
Bridges usually get you from one place to another. This one just gets you.

"Why build a bridge that needs to be guarded?"
—Elvish champion

name: Ensoul Artifact
text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact is a creature with base power and toughness 5/5 in addition to its other types.

editions.flavor: Too often, some self-described genius comes up with a "labor-saving device" that ends up creating far more work.

name: Ensouled Scimitar
text:
{3}: Ensouled Scimitar becomes a 1/5 Spirit artifact creature with flying until end of turn. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)
Equipped creature gets +1/+5.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Entangler
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can block any number of creatures.

editions.flavor: "Tell me again," said Latulla, raising her fist, "how just one woman held back an entire Keldon platoon."

name: Entangling Trap
text: Whenever you clash, tap target creature an opponent controls. If you won, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step. (This ability triggers after the clash ends.)

name: Entangling Vines
text:
Enchant tapped creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

editions.flavor: Every living thing has roots in nature. Sometimes nature gets its roots into you.

name: Entering
text:
Put a creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

name: Enter the Dungeon
text: Players play a Magic subgame under the table starting at 5 life, using their libraries as their decks. After the subgame ends, the winner searches his or her library for two cards, puts those cards into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

name: Enter the Infinite
text: Draw cards equal to the number of cards in your library, then put a card from your hand on top of your library. You have no maximum hand size until your next turn.

editions.flavor:
"Don't just have an idea—have all of them."
—Niv-Mizzet

name: Enthralling Victor
text: When Enthralling Victor enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power 2 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

editions.flavor: If you stare at the sun for too long, you'll lose your ability to see clearly.

name: Entomb
text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: A grave is the safest place to store ill-gotten treasures.
A grave is the safest place to store ill-gotten treasures.

"I'll return once you've ripened."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa
A grave is the safest place to store ill-gotten treasures.

name: Entomber Exarch
text:
When Entomber Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Target opponent reveals his or her hand, you choose a noncreature card from it, then that player discards that card.

name: Entourage of Trest
text:
When Entourage of Trest enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
Entourage of Trest can block an additional creature each combat as long as you're the monarch.

editions.flavor:
"The dim resort to violence, for which the nimble prepare."
—Leovold, emissary of Trest

name: Entrails Feaster
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile a creature card from a graveyard. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Entrails Feaster. If you don't, tap Entrails Feaster.

name: Entrapment Maneuver
text: Target player sacrifices an attacking creature. You create X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens, where X is that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor:
"Greed, rage, and bloodlust all lead to death at the hands of those who keep their heads."
—Sergeant Eyra

name: Entreat the Angels
text:
Create X 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying.
Miracle {X}{W}{W} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

name: Entropic Eidolon
text:
{B}, Sacrifice Entropic Eidolon: Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Entropic Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Entropic Specter
text:
Flying
As Entropic Specter enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Entropic Specter's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in the chosen player's hand.
Whenever Entropic Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

name: Envelop
text: Counter target sorcery spell.

editions.flavor:
"What you made will be unmade. What you learned will be unlearned. And when you're done, you will be undone."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Eon Hub
text: Players skip their upkeep steps.

editions.flavor: Its power source is time itself. It absorbs unused minutes and hours, bringing the end of existence always closer.

name: Ephara, God of the Polis
text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to white and blue is less than seven, Ephara isn't a creature.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if you had another creature enter the battlefield under your control last turn, draw a card.

name: Ephara's Enlightenment
text:
Enchant creature
When Ephara's Enlightenment enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature has flying.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Ephara's Enlightenment to its owner's hand.

name: Ephara's Radiance
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{1}{W}, {T}: You gain 3 life."

editions.flavor:
"Civilization is the sum of Ephara's gifts."
—Olexa of the Twelve

name: Ephara's Warden
text: {T}: Tap target creature with power 3 or less.

editions.flavor: "When you threaten the sanctity of the polis, you insult Ephara herself. If she doesn't smite you, I will."

name: Ephemeral Shields
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Target creature gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)

name: Ephemeron
text:
Flying
Discard a card: Return Ephemeron to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: From nothing came teeth.
From nothing came teeth.
From nothing came teeth.

name: Epic Confrontation
text: Target creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn. It fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

editions.flavor: No matter the timeline, some legends will endure.

name: Epicenter
text:
Target player sacrifices a land.
Threshold — Each player sacrifices all lands he or she controls instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Sometimes destruction is Dominaria's way of rebuilding. Sometimes it's not.

name: Epic Experiment
text: Exile the top X cards of your library. For each instant and sorcery card with converted mana cost X or less among them, you may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Then put all cards exiled this way that weren't cast into your graveyard.

name: Epic Proportions
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +5/+5 and has trample.

editions.flavor: From mite to mighty.

name: Epic Struggle
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control twenty or more creatures, you win the game.

editions.flavor:
"If our foes will not listen to words, perhaps hooves and claws will make them take notice."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Epiphany at the Drownyard
text: Reveal the top X plus one cards of your library and separate them into two piles. An opponent chooses one of those piles. Put that pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Is this what you found, Tamiyo?"
—Jace Beleren

name: Epiphany Storm
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card."

editions.flavor: In Meletis, certain oracles are trained to be divine lightning rods, receiving countless visions in an instant.

name: Epitaph Golem
text: {2}: Put target card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library.

editions.flavor: Many names and many memories bound together in grim purpose.

name: Epochrasite
text:
Epochrasite enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it if you didn't cast it from your hand.
When Epochrasite dies, exile it with three time counters on it and it gains suspend. (At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast this card without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

name: Equal Treatment
text:
If any source would deal 1 or more damage to a creature or player this turn, it deals 2 damage to that creature or player instead.
Draw a card.

name: Equestrian Skill
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
As long as enchanted creature is a Human, it has trample.

editions.flavor: From the jagged peaks of Stensia, to the tangled woods of Kessig, to the bogs of Nephalia, the Gavony Riders prepare for all terrain.

name: Equilibrium
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
Seek balance in all things—as long as the scales are weighted in your favor.
—Vodalian saying
In Rath, there are only so many souls to go around.

name: Equinox
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Counter target spell if it would destroy a land you control."

name: Equipoise
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, for each land target player controls in excess of the number you control, choose a land he or she controls, then the chosen permanents phase out. Repeat this process for artifacts and creatures. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. They phase in before that player untaps during his or her next untap step.)

name: Eradicate
text: Exile target nonblack creature. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that creature and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Era of Innovation
text:
Whenever an artifact or Artificer enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Pay {E}{E}{E}{E}{E}{E}, Sacrifice Era of Innovation: Draw three cards.

name: Erase
text: Exile target enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"Truth is hard enough to see, let alone understand. We must remove all distractions to find clarity."
—Zogye, wandering sage
Perception is more pleasing than truth.

"Don't trust your eyes, for mages are skilled in deception. Trust only in your faith. It will wipe everything clean."
—Lila, Erunian priest

name: Erase (Not the Urza's Legacy One)
text:
If you control two or more white permanents that share an artist, you may play Erase (Not the Urza's Legacy One) without paying its mana cost.
Remove target enchantment from the game.

editions.artist: Pete “Yes the Urza's Legacy One” Venters
editions.flavor: Synonyms for "erase" we haven't used: ablate, abrade, chafe, fray, frazzle, scuff, and scrub.

name: Erayo's Essence
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell for the first time in a turn, counter that spell.

name: Erayo, Soratami Ascendant
text:
Flying
Whenever the fourth spell of a turn is cast, flip Erayo, Soratami Ascendant.

name: Erdwal Illuminator
text:
Flying
Whenever you investigate for the first time each turn, investigate an additional time.

editions.flavor:
"When all else fails, follow the geist's lantern."
—Vallon, Thraben inspector

name: Erdwal Ripper
text:
Haste
Whenever Erdwal Ripper deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: Savage vampires lurk in the Erdwal's network of passageways where prey is plentiful and easy to catch.

name: Erebos, God of the Dead
text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to black is less than five, Erebos isn't a creature. (Each {B} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to black.)
Your opponents can't gain life.
{1}{B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

name: Erebos's Emissary
text:
Bestow {5}{B} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Discard a creature card: Erebos's Emissary gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If Erebos's Emissary is an Aura, enchanted creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn instead.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

name: Erebos's Titan
text:
As long as your opponents control no creatures, Erebos's Titan has indestructible. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
Whenever a creature card leaves an opponent's graveyard, you may discard a card. If you do, return Erebos's Titan from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Erg Raiders
text: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

name: Erhnam Djinn
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

editions.flavor: He provides a safe path to nowhere.
He provides a safe path to nowhere.

name: Erhnam Djinn Avatar
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: He provides a safe path to nowhere.
He provides a safe path to nowhere.

name: Erithizon
text: Whenever Erithizon attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of defending player's choice.

editions.flavor: Unlike scorpions, the erithizon isn't immune to its own weaponry.

name: Eron the Relentless
text:
Haste
{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate Eron the Relentless.

editions.flavor:
"Eron would be much less of a hassle if only he were mortal."
—Reyhan, Samite alchemist

"Eron would be much less of a hassle if only he were mortal."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

name: Erosion
text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, destroy that land unless that player pays {1} or 1 life.

name: Errand of Duty
text: Create a 1/1 white Knight creature token with banding. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor:
"May they speed to their task, for the Skyknights alone cannot hold Kjeldor safe."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

"Call every able sword to our side. Kjeldor will stand triumphant"
—King Darien of Kjeldor

"May they speed to their task, for the skyknights alone cannot hold Kjeldor safe."
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain

name: Errant Doomsayers
text: {T}: Tap target creature with toughness 2 or less.

editions.flavor: "Heed my words, traveler. Plagues, war, desolation . . . all mere hints of what is yet to come from Dominaria's vault of horrors."

name: Errant Ephemeron
text:
Flying
Suspend 4—{1}{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{U} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra

name: Errant Minion
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay any amount of mana. Errant Minion deals 2 damage to that player. Prevent X of that damage, where X is the amount of mana that player paid this way.

editions.flavor: Abandon not your faith when others abandon you.
